intro: Cyrtandra pulgarensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokai in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to white. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Cyrtandra pulgarensis is a rare species, facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
